intro: Gyaladenia friesii, commonly known as the Alpine bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to violet. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils at high altitudes, often in mountainous areas. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its habitat preferences, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many parts of its range.
